title: Tegan and Sara respond to Jojo Siwa's claim of having invented 'Gay Pop'.
description: Tegan and Sara have been queer icons in the music industry for over 2 decades. So when Jojo Siwa claimed to be inventing 'Gay Pop' they responded.
excerpt: "I'm just rolling over in my own grave."
text: "I'm just rolling over in my own grave." Tegan and Sara have been queer icons in the music industry for over 2 decades. So when Jojo Siwa claimed to be inventing 'Gay Pop' they responded on their social media channels. In this video, Mashable Entertainment Editor, Kristy Puchko, asks them to explain their response.Fanatical: The Catfishing of Tegan and Sara is now streaming on Hulu Oct. 18. Kristy Puchko is the Film Editor at Mashable. Based in New York City, she's an established film critic and entertainment reporter, who has traveled the world on assignment, covered a variety of film festivals, co-hosted movie-focused podcasts, interviewed a wide array of performers and filmmakers, and had her work published on RogerEbert.com, Vanity Fair, and The Guardian. A member of the Critics Choice Association and GALECA as well as a Top Critic on Rotten Tomatoes, Kristy's primary focus is movies. html:
"I'm just rolling over in my own grave."

Tegan and Sara have been queer icons in the music industry for over 2 decades. So when Jojo Siwa claimed to be inventing 'Gay Pop' they responded on their social media channels. In this video, Mashable Entertainment Editor, Kristy Puchko, asks them to explain their response.

Fanatical: The Catfishing of Tegan and Sara is now streaming on Hulu Oct. 18.

Kristy Puchko is the Film Editor at Mashable. Based in New York City, she's an established film critic and entertainment reporter, who has traveled the world on assignment, covered a variety of film festivals, co-hosted movie-focused podcasts, interviewed a wide array of performers and filmmakers, and had her work published on RogerEbert.com, Vanity Fair, and The Guardian. A member of the Critics Choice Association and GALECA as well as a Top Critic on Rotten Tomatoes, Kristy's primary focus is movies. However, she's also been known to gush over television, podcasts, and board games. You can follow her on Twitter.
